chapter.title: Configuration folder
chapter.para: The configuration folder contains most of the user preferences.

note.para: If anything happens to your OmegaT installation and you can't seem to fix it, the first step is to stop OmegaT, create a backup of the configuration folder's contents, delete the original configuration folder it and restart OmegaT.

section.title: Configuration folder location
section.para: The configuration folder is where most of the OmegaT parameters are stored for a given user.

The configuration folder's location depends on your computer (the ~ character corresponds to the user's home directory):
Linux
~/.omegat macOS
~/Library/Preferences/OmegaT Windows
~\AppData\Roaming\OmegaT
You can always access the configuration folder directly with from the menu.

listitem.para: This file includes a number of important user preferences.
This file describes the OmegaT's general layout.
This folder contains a number of log files, of which the most current is OmegaT.log.
This file records Java messages while OmegaT is running. Should OmegaT appear to be behaving erratically, it is important to include this file or the relevant part in any bug report.
That file is also available from in the menu.

This folder can contain 3 text files:
selection.txt
This file contains the selection when in the is used. The file contents is updated every time the function is called. source.txt
This file contains the source part of the current segment when in the menu is set. The file contents is updated every time a new segment is entered. target.txt
This file contains the target part of the current segment when in the is set. The file contents is updated every time a new segment is entered.
The three files can be used as a simple way to access some contents from OmegaT and to process it with local programs (shell scripts, etc.).

section.title: Configuration folder setting
section.para: You can specify a configuration folder different from the default one when you start OmegaT from the command line. When you do that, all the preferences set from the dialog will be registered in that folder and won't be available to other instances of OmegaT that will start with a different configuration folder. See for details.
